metadata.Title: CVE-2009-4016 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer underflow in the clean_string function in irc_string.c in (1)IRCD-hybrid 7.2.2 and 7.2.3, (2) ircd-ratbox before 2.2.9, and (3)oftc-hybrid before 1.6.8, when flatten_links is disabled, allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (daemoncrash) via a LINKS command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-4016` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ircd-hybrid - 1:7.2.2.dfsg.2-6ubuntu3
No subscription required

ircd-ratbox - 3.0.8.dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ircd-hybrid package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:7.2.2.dfsg.2-6ubuntu3').
ircd-ratbox package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.8.dfsg-1').
